quotes.quote: Diamond is the hardest substance, but the Irony, it is also brittle.
There are two kinds of diamonds in this world: The diamond itself and the eyes full of love!
Diamond being the toughest thing on the face of earth is still the most prettiest object; pretty is not always being honeyed.
Our dreams are our precious diamonds; without them, we are endlessly poor. Let us perpetually dream to be overly wealthy!
A diamond is a piece of coal that stuck to the job.
The soul is placed in the body like a rough diamond, and must be polished, or the luster of it will never appear.
The diamond has been always esteemed the rarest stone, and the most precious of all: among the ancients it was called the stone of reconciliation.
It is no more easy to make a good picture than it is to find a diamond or a pearl. It means trouble and you risk your life for it.
Angels are like diamonds. They can't be made, you have to find them. Each one is unique.
Diamonds are found only in the dark places of the earth, truths are found only in the depths of thought.
Easy-to know that diamonds-are precious, Good-to learn that rubies-have depth, But more-to see that pebbles-are miraculous.
A diamond with a flaw is worth more than a pebble without imperfections.
One beautiful diamond is worth more than a mountain of stones, and one virtuous act of acquiescence and submission is better than an abundance of good works done for others.
The diamond which shines in the Saviour's crown shall burn in unquenched beauty at last on the forehead of every human soul.
Diamonds are a key component in the campaign to make poverty history.
The diamond is the hardest stone -- to get.
A diamond is just a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well.
Diamonds are intrinsically worthless, except for the deep psychological need they fill.
A diamond, incarcerated in its subterraneous prison, rough and unpolished, differs not from a common stone.
Every diamond has the ability to shine when there is someone to recognize its good facets and inhibit its flaws.
A diamond on a dunghill is a precious diamond still.
A diamond, though set in horns, is still a diamond, and sparkles in purest gold.
Diamonds are nothing more than chunks of coal that stuck to their jobs.

Just as a diamond can only be polished by another diamond, it is only through genuine, all-out engagement with others that people can polish their character, and help each other to reach greater heights.
Diamonds are trumps in the game of hearts.
A big diamond necklace is nouveau riche, really. People who have wealth a long time don't wear such things.
If you sell diamonds, you cannot expect to have many customers. But a diamond is a diamond even if there are no customers.
Diamonds have an image of purity and light. They are given as a pledge of love and worn as a symbol of commitment.
That something so small could be so beautiful. Worth so much. Only the strongest people can turn away from feelings like that.
A diamond, which is the hardest of stones, not yielding unto steel, emery or any other thing, is yet made soft by the blood of a goat.
Remember diamonds are created under pressure so hold on, it will be your time to shine soon.
A diamond, is a woman's last resort to love.
